distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for sqlite is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
SQLite is a C library that implements an SQL database engine. A large subset of SQL92 is supported. A complete database is stored in a single disk file. The API is designed for convenience and ease of use. Applications that link against SQLite can enjoy the power and flexibility of an SQL database without the administrative hassles of supporting a separate database server.

Security Fix(es):

* sqlite: heap out-of-bound read in function rtreenode() (CVE-2019-8457)

* sqlite: fts3: improve shadow table corruption detection (CVE-2019-13752)

* sqlite: fts3: incorrectly removed corruption check (CVE-2019-13753)

* sqlite: mishandling of certain uses of SELECT DISTINCT involving a LEFT JOIN in flattenSubquery in select.c leads to a NULL pointer dereference (CVE-2019-19923)

* sqlite: incorrect sqlite3WindowRewrite() error handling leads to mishandling certain parser-tree rewriting (CVE-2019-19924)

* sqlite: zipfileUpdate in ext/misc/zipfile.c mishandles a NULL pathname during an update of a ZIP archive (CVE-2019-19925)

* sqlite: mishandles certain uses of INSERT INTO in situations involving embedded '\0' characters in filenames (CVE-2019-19959)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: sqlite security and bug fix update

notes.text: SQLite3 from 3.6.0 to and including 3.27.2 is vulnerable to heap out-of-bound read in the rtreenode() function when handling invalid rtree tables.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: heap out-of-bound read in function rtreenode()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: heap out-of-bound read in function rtreenode()

notes.text: Out of bounds read in SQLite in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.79 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTML page.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: fts3: improve shadow table corruption detection
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: fts3: improve shadow table corruption detection

notes.text: Out of bounds read in SQLite in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.79 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTML page.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: fts3: incorrectly removed corruption check
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: fts3: incorrectly removed corruption check

notes.text: flattenSubquery in select.c in SQLite 3.30.1 mishandles certain uses of SELECT DISTINCT involving a LEFT JOIN in which the right-hand side is a view. This can cause a NULL pointer dereference (or incorrect results).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: mishandling of certain uses of SELECT DISTINCT involving a LEFT JOIN in flattenSubquery in select.c leads to a NULL pointer dereference
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: mishandling of certain uses of SELECT DISTINCT involving a LEFT JOIN in flattenSubquery in select.c leads to a NULL pointer dereference

notes.text: SQLite 3.30.1 mishandles certain parser-tree rewriting, related to expr.c, vdbeaux.c, and window.c. This is caused by incorrect sqlite3WindowRewrite() error handling.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: incorrect sqlite3WindowRewrite() error handling leads to mishandling certain parser-tree rewriting
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: incorrect sqlite3WindowRewrite() error handling leads to mishandling certain parser-tree rewriting

notes.text: zipfileUpdate in ext/misc/zipfile.c in SQLite 3.30.1 mishandles a NULL pathname during an update of a ZIP archive.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: zipfileUpdate in ext/misc/zipfile.c mishandles a NULL pathname during an update of a ZIP archive
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The zip extension was introduced in sqlite-3.22.0, therefore previous versions are not affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: sqlite: zipfileUpdate in ext/misc/zipfile.c mishandles a NULL pathname during an update of a ZIP archive

cwe.name: Null Byte Interaction Error (Poison Null Byte)

notes.text: ext/misc/zipfile.c in SQLite 3.30.1 mishandles certain uses of INSERT INTO in situations involving embedded '\0' characters in filenames, leading to a memory-management error that can be detected by (for example) valgrind.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: sqlite: mishandles certain uses of INSERT INTO in situations involving embedded '\0' characters in filenames
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The zip extension was introduced in sqlite-3.22.0, therefore previous versions are not affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
